definition: a form of theatrical double act in which one performer speaks or sings while the other, in front, pretends to be doing the speaking or singing/double reed (as in an oboe or bassoon)
surname Shuang
two/double/pair/both/even (number)
metallic reed/spring of lock
double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
lit. to sing a duet/fig. to collaborate with sb/also used satirically: to play second fiddle to

sentences.english: The oboist is well known for his improvisation.
sentences.chinese: 这位双簧管吹奏者以即兴演奏而著名。

sentences.english: Like to play flute and oboe .
sentences.chinese: 爱好长笛和双簧管演奏。

sentences.english: Quartet for Flute, Oboe, Cello and Harpsichord.
sentences.chinese: 长笛四重奏，双簧管，大提琴和大键琴。

sentences.english: The oboe and cello sat alone , echoing tone for tone.
sentences.chinese: 双簧管和大提琴双重奏，音调此起彼伏。

sentences.english: I encourage oboe and clarinet players to use plenty of vibrato .
sentences.chinese: 我鼓励演奏双簧管和单簧管的乐手们多使用颤音。

sentences.english: The oboist is well know for his improvisation.
sentences.chinese: 这位双簧管吹奏者以即兴演奏而著名。

sentences.english: She has taken up the oboe .
The oboe is a double reed wind instrument.
sentences.chinese: 双簧管是一个具有两片簧片的管乐器。

sentences.english: Out performs outlasts traditional single knife-edge doors.
sentences.chinese: 比传统单刀双簧屏蔽门更加持久的屏蔽效能。

sentences.english: The double bass and the oboe have different timbres.
sentences.chinese: 双簧管与低音提琴的音色不同。

sentences.english: Wind instruments include the piri (cylindrical oboe), taepyeongso (metal-bell shawm), daegeumsaenghwang (mouth organ) and the hun (ocarina).
sentences.chinese: 管乐器包括圆柱形双簧管，金属芦笛，口琴和陶笛。

to echo one another (idiom)
to play the role of the hero (idiom)/to play the good cop
comic crosstalk/formalized comic dialogue between two stand-up comics: funny man 逗哏[dou4 gen2] and straight man 捧哏[peng3 gen2]
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to play the role of the villain (idiom)
allegro
fiction comes true/play-acting that turns into reality
lit. a thief crying "Stop the thief!" (idiom)/fig. to accuse sb of a theft and try to sneak away oneself/to cover up one's misdeeds by shifting the blame onto others
to act in collusion (idiom)
acrobatics/jugglery/cheap trick/game
beat boxing/vocal mimicry/ventriloquism
funny man (lead role in comic dialogue 對口相聲|对口相声[dui4 kou3 xiang4 sheng1])/to joke/to play the fool/to provoke laughter
to collude/to collaborate/to gang up
folk theater consisting of recitation accompanied by clapper board rhythm
to act in a play/to put on a play
